intro: Serruria concinna, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge, giving it its scientific name. Serruria concinna is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
